value.title: Extract Parts of a Text Value in Power BI using a Delimiter Power Query Transformation
value.excerpt: If you have a text field and you want to extract a part of that text field, there are multiple ways to do that. You can do this using the SUBSTRING function in DAX. However, These types of actions are better to be done using Power Query transformations. Fortunately, Power Query is very easy and simple

value.title: Split Column by Delimiter in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: If you have a delimiter character (or part of the text) that is repeated multiple times, and you want to extract all the text parts based on that, there is a simple way for it. In this article, I'll explain how to extract multiple parts of a text value based on a delimiter in Power BI using Power Query.

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day
value.excerpt: The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports. We recommend you watch the videos in the recorded sequence, starting with video 1 and ending with video 24.

value.title: Create and use analytics reports with Power BI
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to Power BI, and teaches you to use and build business intelligence reports.

topItems.title: Get started building with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power BI is a collection of software services and applications that let you connect to all sorts of data sources and create compelling visuals and reports. You can benefit from receiving those reports, or you can share them with others inside or outside your organization. Learn the basics of Power BI, how its services and applications work together, and how they can be used to create or experience compelling visuals and analytics based on your data.

topItems.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
topItems.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

topItems.title: Model data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Connect Power BI to multiple data sources to create reports. Define the relationship between your data sources.

topItems.title: Use visuals in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Taking Buttons in Power BI Desktop to the Next Level
value.excerpt: Amanda Cofsky joins us to show how you can use buttons, in Power BI Desktop, to take your reports to the next level. Blank buttons can really make your Power BI Reports shine. value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: 20 tricks to finally master the Matrix visualization in Power BI!!
value.excerpt: The matrix visualization has over 100 configuration options, and some of the most basic functionality, like hiding subtotals is not so easy to discover.  In today's video, I will show you 20 things you can do on the matrix that will take that visualization to the next level.  Did I miss any? Let me know
